Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek ostracon
Description: This Greek ostracon is a receipt given by the banker of wheat, Phatres, to a certain Harthothes who had delivered 210 sacks of wheat  to pay for the farm tenency of a plot of land belonging to a temple. The document is dated Year 19 of the reign of Augustus, or the 25th of June in the year 11 before Christ.
